reviews.title: Poor customer service and luggage carrying
text: This service is very poor with luggage handling. I traveled from Torronoto to Montreal, my new suit case was badly manhandled and torn from multiple sides. I reported this to staff who were not cooperative at all. Later I contacted the service through email but to no avail. Don't recommend this service especially if carrying luggage.

reviews.title: 3rd world country transportation
text: I booked a late evening trip from Toronto to Montreal. I went at the terminal; sat in this crowded bus for 5 mins then left... I could not see myself sitting in this bus for 6h! The seats were uncomfortable and the space was small and crowded. It is one of the worst bus I have seen even compared to Mexico or the Philippines. I was excited for the trip and just wanted to relax and be driven; but I guess I will just take my car - which is about the same price in gas for 1 person (so for 2 there is no competition).
It is so sad transportation in Canada suck so much... such a shame :(
Also, they don't want to refund me. I think it is unfair; you pay without seeing the product then they don't want to refund even a small part as a gesture?
Conclusion, whatever the price; it is not worth it...

reviews.title: Hate megabus montreal2toronto
text: Montreal to Toronto: Pahetic serice, rude staff, broke my luggage tyre, arrival at union is even wose worse people, mishandling luggage, despite showing extra ticket for extra luggage asking why you have extra luggage weird. Is there any other bus company for next time?

reviews.title: Do not recommend at all!
text: Last Wednesday, my bf and I wanted to visit Niagara Falls and booked a trip from Toronto with Megabus. Early in the morning, we were at the station to board. But unfortunately our tickets were not valid for that day but the week after (when we’re already back in Europe).

We asked the Megabus service lady at the station who could not help us but told us to contact Megabus customer service online. Which we did. The first response was quick and included links to “trade-in” our tickets. So we were looking forward to having our trip on that day still. But this trade in thing was very expensive (about the price that we already paid or even more on top). So this was not an affordable option for us. Later we wanted to take a look for the next day but the “trade in” did not work anymore. I explained that unlucky situation to customer service many times and kindly asked for a refund. A cancellation should be possible, at least when the trip is one week ahead and still other people could book those tickets and go on that trip. But for Megabus it’s not possible. They offered a code that I could use within one year, but it does not make sense since it’s not valid where I’m from and I won’t return to Canada any time soon. So that’s it. I regret that I haven’t checked those reviews here before I booked.
Thank you for nothing.

reviews.title: Megabus is the worst, DO NOT USE
text: I work in downtown Toronto and wanted to visit a friend in London ON. With train it takes approximately 2 hours 15 minutes. Right now it is 8pm, i bought the ticket for 5:15. I think i have at least 2 hours more to go. So, total trip with Megabus will be 5 hours maybe even more that i could actually go in 2 hours with a train. Seats are too narrow, i dont remember i have worse experience than this.

I recently had a deeply disappointing experience with Megabus on my trips between Montreal, Toronto, and Niagara Falls. Despite being a frequent traveler, the service I received was far below expectations, and I feel compelled to share my experience.

Multiple Delays: My bus from Montreal to Toronto was over 3 hours late, causing me to arrive much later than planned and forcing me to walk 25 minutes to my accommodation late at night. Similarly, my trip from Toronto to Niagara Falls was delayed, cutting my visit short. The return trip to Montreal saw additional delays, leaving me to navigate public transport alone at 3 AM.

Misinformation from Staff: The most frustrating part was the misinformation I received from a driver, leading me to miss a bus that I was told would stop at a specific location. This resulted in unexpected expenses when I had to buy a ticket from another carrier. When I sought help from Megabus staff, they were unable to assist me.

Lack of Accountability: Despite the numerous issues, Megabus has not offered proper compensation for the expenses incurred or the significant inconvenience caused. Their response has been unsatisfactory, with an unwillingness to take responsibility for their service failures.
Given my experience, I cannot recommend Megabus. If you value your time and money, consider other options for your travel needs.

reviews.title: Dirty and noisy
text: Don't recommend taking it. Extremely loud muffler noise with a funky smell of rotting food. Seats were not clean.  Horrible service.

reviews.title: Megabus
text: The bus was SO NOISY! People listening to youtube without earbuds, people talking on speakers, people sitting behind me with their socks off and their feet between my seats!!! It was so rude!!! If I had to ask them a favor, it would be when the driver makes the announcement before the bus starts.....put your phone on vibrate mode and make a sound before the train starts to quiet the bus for everyone else! I couldn't sleep for 7 hours...it was the worst ~I paid $50 extra and took the train back home.

reviews.title: Terrible Experience with a Mega Bus Rude Bus Driver (Toronto to Niagara Falls)
text: My recent trip from Toronto to Niagara Falls was ruined by an extremely rude bus driver in the morning/early afternoon on the 26th of September.

I was traveling with my girlfriend and her mom where the bus-driver who showed a terrible attitude towards us by screaming very aggressively towards us and made us look ridiculous. He was acting dismissive and unprofessional when my girlfriend asked a simple question about the bus stops, responding with aggressive and sarcastic.

My girlfriend is deaf on one of her ears. At the point, when my girlfriend asked if this was the correct stop for Niagara Falls, the driver responded very aggressively. There are two bus stops in Niagara Falls, and we simply wanted to confirm we were at the right one. His behaviour made the ride and our trip uncomfortable and stressful as this bad experience impacted our trip towards Niagara Falls as tourists and especially towards my girlfriend.
As paying customers, the way he treated us was beyond unacceptable, and it felt as though he might have had something against customers with Asian descent.
It’s a shame because Niagara Falls itself is a beautiful scenic, but having to deal with such an unprofessional and rude driver completely overshadowed the experience.
I strongly recommend avoiding the Mega Bus service if you want to enjoy your trip without being treated disrespectfully.
We also experienced that the bus came much later when we were heading from Niagara Falls back to Toronto than it should have departure.

reviews.title: Very good bus service
text: Very efficient, quick and comfortable.  Used the overnight bus from Montreal to Toronto to catch the train to Niagara Falls.  Had to use the bus back to Toronto when the train failed to arrive.  Cost 3x more, but far quicker.

reviews.title: Absolute waste of $50
text: Got there 10 minutes early to the gate at the Toronto bus terminal, I asked one of the women who helped operate the bus if the queue where she was is where I needed to be. She looked already moody and told me no it’s not, told me I need to go on the queue to the left of her even though I told her Niagara Falls and the bus behind her was for Niagara Falls. So then I queue on this other side only to find that it was a queue for a bus to America and then this same moody woman gets in the Niagara Falls bus with the driver and drives off. Use GO next time or some other transportation company, Megabus are a waste of money and time.

reviews.title: Scam
text: this is honestly the WORSE experience EVER. booked for 9AM on june 8th. Went to the SAME address that was described in my email, got there and.... No bus. I NEVER found the bus NEVER. Only to get told we weren't in the good place. We got there 15min in advance as advised in the email, but all the time for our search for the bus we obviously got late. I emailed the company for a refund but they refused to give me one. I send them THREE screenshots of the wrong address they gave me for them to send me in a email the EXACT same one as mine??? This is a scam don't get fooled.

reviews.title: Absolutely horrible! driver wont change temp it’s 28oC in June on Overnight bus for 6hrs.
text: I am on the bus right now Montreal to Toronto 1130pm-545am. I have asked the driver not to turn the heat up again. He had it over 25 degrees. He argued with me saying it wasn’t just up to me. Of course not, I didn’t think it was. Then he made a comment about if it was good enough for me when we stopped in Kingston. We were also delayed in Kingston waiting for a late bus.  We are seated upstairs on the bus. we are all sweating and can’t sleep. For the people that might be cold at 21 degrees bring a jacket with you and close your vent. I am travelling in a sauna for 5 hrs. If I could get off the bus with my children I would. I will never travel with megabus again. Take the train instead.

Just asked the driver to turn it down once again. He told he had to keep at normal temperature of 28 degrees. I’ve asked him again to turn it to 21 degrees room temperature. Once again he was very rude.

reviews.title: Don’t ever use their service, rent a car instead.
text: My recent experience with Megabus was absolutely horrendous. Despite arriving on time, we were denied boarding without any valid reason. To make matters worse, the online customer service was completely nonexistent, offering no assistance whatsoever.
The local staff's behavior was downright rude and disrespectful. They literally shut the door in our faces even though we were perfectly on schedule. This disregard for customers is unacceptable.
I strongly advise against using Megabus for your travel needs. Their lack of professionalism and abysmal customer service are not worth the risk or frustration.

reviews.title: Megabus nightmare
text: I just experienced a Megabus nightmare. I had made a reservation, and paid for a seat choice, both ways to/from Pearson Airport traveling from Kingston. Going I was stuck on some bus, that only had two seats available (neither being the seat I paid extra for) to go to Pearson. I left my self enough time at both ends to assure my getting to and from Pearson on time. Traffic was so bad I had to get off Megabus at Union station and make my way the airport using another mode of transportation. I do not know TO but made it to the airport with little time to spare thanks with the help of a young lady from TO. Coming home I stood outside at Pearson where the buses pick up customers for several hours waiting for Megabus to show up at the airport. Never did. I had to make my own way back to Union station and catch a via train back home. When I finally connected with a human customer service rep I was made to feel like I was lying and told the bus was there. I cut Megabus some slack on the first part as I did, even with a lot of trouble, not miss my plane to the UK. But to end my trip with no bus, and no way to contact Megabus to inquire why the bus was not where Megabus  said on my confirmation sheet it to be was the straw that broke the camels back. I came back on the 31st and just yesterday customer service sent me an email that basically said I was wrong and they were right. I will never use them again, and my advice to those trying to make a flight and want to book Megabus to get them there...don't.

reviews.title: don't ride megabus
text: I was waiting at the only bus depot in Niagara Falls for the Flix bus.  It turns out they don't pick up at the bus depot.  I would soon discover why they do not.
Since I missed the pickup for my Flix bus which picks up downtown Niagara Falls, I went up to clerk to buy a ticket for the Megabus that had just arrived and was about to leave.

Flix charged by just under 20 dollars after tax.  Megabus charged $58 plus tax.  They said it was last minute pricing.  I could see on the bus.  The bus had a lot of empty seats -- but nope charge me surge pricing.  I asked how much it would be for later buses if I just didn't take it.  The checker. said I can't got at 6, because that is the last minute pricing too.

The bus stops at many different places driving slowly on. city roads while the Flix bus takes the highway.  Well hey someone might need to get on there you might say -- well actually no one got on and no one got off -- but they still stopped all over the place.
The same trip the flex does in 80-90 minutes the MegaBus takes between 2.5-3 hours.
So pay 400% the price, for a less convenient pickup location, to arrive 2x slower,

I mean I have to admit, I wish I could be writing a good review.  I don't drive and I wish more people took the bus.  This is the bus you don't want to take.  If you don't normally take the bus -- don't take this bus, it will be the reason you never want to take buses.  If you do take buses often, don't take this bus, It will make you wish you had a car despite the extra emissions from your travel.

reviews.title: Buy early as prices surge closer to departure time
text: A week ago, the price for 2 adults to travel from Toronto to Niagara Falls was $20 online. I decided to wait because my plans were not firm. Yesterday it went to $40 but I was unsure whether I would travel at 11:30 or 12:30 so I waited until I got to Union Station. It was a little under 1 hr from departure time & the online price was now $80. I was already in line & the agent quoted me $99.

The lesson here is buy tickets early if your plans are firm because the high surge is unreasonable. Thankfully there were other choices so my husband & I took GoTrain & GoBus for $30 total. The price stayed the same when I looked 1 & 4 weeks ago. It look longer than Megabus because there was a transfer & wait with our route. But the Go agents were all very nice & helpful and the price so much better.
PS when I had called Megabus a week ago asking about prices, the agent told me prices can be different online & in person. It would have been better for her to advise me to buy early to save.

reviews.title: Never again!!!
text: Absolutely terrible experience: I would like to touch some point
My trip was Toronto-Montreal-Toronto

Very Old Bus,Also uncomfortable seat, no entertainment on board, no music, or anything to show on Tv… MegaBus what? Almost  7 hours trip, bathroom without sink on the bus disgusting just wet wipes Wow I never see something like that before ..Break?Only 10 min stop …Definitely never again with Megabus, I don't recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: Dude driver at London flying J, 6:25am on Friday April 12
text: I use maga bus once a week, super affordable and comfy, but I do not appreciate the arrogance this one bus driver gives off. He sped through the parking lot, super close to me. I saw him coming and was standing close to my vehicle and looked down at my phone for literally 10 seconds to find my ticket and the man Alonso hit me. That’s one thing but having the driver get out of his seat like a sloth then telling me off cause o was “on my phone and not paying attention” even though he was the one approaching us. Maybe he’s having a bad morning but he was not in the right to be telling me off because of that. Completely rude.

reviews.title: Very disappointed
text: Bus driver FORGOT us.
The trip was from Toronto to Montreal. After one hour waiting in our stop in Kingston some passengers complained and the company realized there was no driver for us.

reviews.title: Awful and expensive
text: Expensive and staff completely unhelpful, avoid if any other options available.  Wouldn't let us catch an earlier bus even though others hadn't turned up and seats were empty.

reviews.title: Late with no point in reserving seats
text: Always late. No point in paying extra for reserved seats. It is a free for all. Your seat will be taken or they change the buses with 0 notice

reviews.title: Megabus destroys our day
text: return trip from Table Tock, Niagara Falls to Toronto

We were waiting for our Megabus coach forever, all the while a Coach Canada bus was standing right in front of us.  Only after that bus had left did we find out that this was in fact our Megabus ride and that we had missed it. The driver never bothered to call out for Megabus customers, there was no Megabus sign or logo in or on the bus that would have indicated that Coach Canada operated this connection on behalf of Megabus.  We had to wait for the next bus (again Coach Canada) for an hour and then beg the driver to let us on board. Our seat reservations were void and there was the real possibility that at any stop on the way back we might be asked to get off the bus if there were more passengers booked on that connection. We arrived very late and very tired.

reviews.title: Not all mega us are white & printed with the word ‘Megabus’
text: Megabus provides cheap transportation between Union station and Niagara Falls. They were very punctual. Getting from Union was a breeze as there was a clear digital board at the bus terminal. Bus was white & had ‘Megabus’ printed across it.  Driver was very friendly & attentive .

However boarding from Niagara Falls was disastrous as the Table Rock bus stop was a short distance  away from the buses pick-up point. Our bus came  but it was a red one printed Coach Canada. How on earth are we to know it’s a Megabus? The driver didn’t get to the bus stop to check if he had passengers waiting when he should have a record of our bookings & expecting us.

We waited for another hour before the white bus with megabus printing came along & the Chinese driver told us they have 2 versions of it. Thankfully he agreed to fetch us to Union & recorded our booking no.

reviews.title: Fail.
text: Changed the pick up location without obvious notice or signage causing us to miss the bus to Pearson airport for a flight. Would not refund the ticket. Terrible customer service.

reviews.title: Never again!
text: My wife and I had booked a one way megabus ticket on May 16’24 from Belleville Ontario to Pearson airport.

On May 10’24 we were informed via email that the pickup time and location had changed. We arranged for a drive to where we thought the location was and met a couple of elderly women destined for Ireland and who had also bought tickets to get to the airport.

When the bus didn’t arrive at the said time, I called customer service and they acknowledged the bus was late arriving but would be there soon. We waited and soon noticed a megabus a considerable way up the street. One of the mid 80’s women tried her best to run and flag the bus down but the driver ignored her and drove off. I again called customer service and they agreed to have my concern investigated.

Since then I have been dealing with customer service in efforts of getting reimbursed  and have been insulted beyond anything I have ever encountered. Condescendingly they say they are sorry and refuse to acknowledge how their original change of location was confusing at best.
Needless to say we will never consider Megabus again when travelling.

reviews.title: Cheap and Effective.
text: Cheapest way to get to Ottawa. Nobody sitting next to me, wifi, wall outlets. Bus was clean. Everything worked. If you're looking for something cheaper than the train, this is it. I guess some people had some problems, but I got lucky. If you book far in advance it's really cheap.

reviews.title: Awful experience
text: Absolutely awful. Someone took my headphones on the bus and I asked the bus driver what I can do and he basically yelled at me and telling me there’s nothing he can do. Then once we got off was laughing and pointing at me with a co worker. The manager then came up to me and told me I could’ve asked the driver to call the police but he didn’t give me that option and since the bus was dropped off and the person probably went away they can’t do anything. Bus driver Franky who drove from Toronto to Kingston on June 27th 2024 at 3pm I hope you one day to learn to have empathy for people.

reviews.title: Punctual is not in their dictionary
text: Bus is always late, one hour stop in the middle of our trip and the driver is missing. Had a meeting based on my arrival time but have to miss it now. Horrible company

reviews.title: Expensive and horrible!!
text: How can you pay $100 for a bus ride where the washroom doesn't have a sink to wash the hand!! I don't recommend this company!

reviews.title: Profit over People
text: My mom, an elderly woman, bought a ticket from the town we live in to Toronto not realizing the bus went to the Toronto airport, which is where she was going. When we noticed that, we tried to: (i) change her ticket (it was too late); or (ii) purchase a ticket for the other lag of the journey (TO downtown to TO airport) but you cannot buy tickets from downtown TO to the TO airport. My mother asked the employee if she could stay on the bus to complete her journey (instead of having to transfer to the UP train), the answer was a curt "not unless you have the right ticket".

I know it was not a seating issue, because it was not possible to purchase a ticket for that second lag. It was purely because they charge more than double to go the extra half an hour to the airport... And we would have paid it, if we could have.
I am absolutely disgusted and would NEVER recommend MegaBus to anybody!!

reviews.title: The worst company someone can choose to travel with!
text: I had a travel from London,On to Toronto which was supposed to be at 6 am. The bus had no show until 6:50 am without any update to inform passengers. All people were staying there for some bus to show! Finally,  I took another bus from another company! When asked for some response from MEGABUS later, they did not accept their fault. Terrible! Cannot believe them!

reviews.title: Book if you never want to arrive!
text: Only book this service if you are prepared to never make it to your destination. Megabus left me stranded when 3 buses failed to turn up despite their call centre telling me the bus was 5 minutes away. Also, don’t expect a refund when the bus doesn’t arrive, just offered a voucher!! The worst company, no way you could call it service in any way!

reviews.title: Avoid whatsoever
text: Super bad experience, extremely dirty and super bad smell. Rude staff, unhelpful and wont make a single effort to help. First and last time i use it

reviews.title: FIRST AND LAST EXPERIENCE WITH MEGABUS
text: It's was my first megabus expérience and it was terrible.
One good advice.
Book a train you will waste your money and way more time than supposed with megabus

reviews.title: Late, confusing, and very rude
text: Bus was late, parked at the wrong stop, bus was branded as Coach Canada (not MegaBus) and sign on the bus said it was going downtown Toronto. The incredibly rude bus driver was confounded and irritated that we confirmed if it was this was the correct bus that was going to a very different location than the bus said it was going.

reviews.title: Very late, not worth the savings...
text: I thought I was "beating the system" -> I'd jump on a bus to Kingston, meet up with my mom to drive to Ottawa, then train home from there. I lost.

'Megabus' might be more successful - or at least honest - if they added a "t" to their brand; it was a bust. The schedule ahead of mine, expected to leave at 11pm should have been my clue, as it was already an hour late when I got to the station.
"Long story short": my bus left approx. 100 minutes late, the bus was an older, smelly version (old Greyhound perhaps?), with little comfort, no wifi, etc.
Take the train (or fly!)

reviews.title: Scammed out of 85$
text: Megabus is a total scam, these greedy scumbags have no human compassion, they can’t understand that life doesn’t goes our way, they do not offer refunds under any circumstances. I really do hope that one someone she’s them and they will be oblige to reimburse everyone from who they’ve stolen from. Please DO NOT use Megabus, it is a mega disappointment

reviews.title: Literally use any other service, I've never used Tripadvisor before and I came on just to rant about Megabus
text: They don't do refunds/cancellations but it took forever for the website to let me change my reservation. When I emailed customer service, they only told me how to purchase a new ticket. My old ticket was about $20 more than the new one I changed it to, but not only did they not cover the difference, they made me pay $15 out of pocket to change my reservation in the first place (well in advance). They charge $7 to do it with your phone. They pull so much money out of you in additional fees and they charge $3.99 just to book a ticket with them. You can't even select a seat ahead of time unless it's a particular one. I paid an extra $15 when the difference on my old ticket would've covered it, but they made me pay it out of pocket anyway, when I already paid approx. $100 for the first one. They also only refund a credit, and give you 10 mins to use the credit to pay for a new ticket. It's crazy that I had to pay more when my credit was more than the new ticket. Guess I'll try to not have a family emergency next time.

reviews.title: Never Booking Again, Horrible Experience
text: I normally do not leave any type of reviews, but I would not wish this on my worst enemy. Paid $160 for a roundtrip from Toronto to Niagara Falls (3x people), the morning bus was fine. The wifi was not working even though they said there would be wifi. The bus arrived on time in the morning, thought it was all fine. Then in the evening we had paid for a trip back ticket at approximately 9:15 PM. We arrived at the location by 8:45 PM, even though they said you only have to be there 15 min in advance, we wanted to be early just in case.

9:15 comes around. No bus. We check the tracking website and it said delayed by a few minutes. Few minutes turned into a few more, and a few more, and MANY more. We were waiting for OVER an hour. We stopped waiting because the tracking site changed to “NO LONGER TRACKABLE.”

We were shocked, because we KNEW we did not miss it. We were there early and there was 10+ other people waiting for Megabus with us. THE BUS NEVER CAME!!! NEVER!!, WE WERE THERE UNTIL 11 PM (ALMOST 2 HOURS), also it was very late and no other busses came until 11 so we had no choice but to wait for whatever would come. We called but they did NOT have 24/7 costumer service. We had to pay for another bus, which was so expensive because we bought the tickets last minute so I think the prices were higher. We had to pay an ADDITIONAL $130 (3x people) for the other bus that came at 11 PM (not a Megabus), and this was only for a one way trip, 160 is more but that was supposed to be for two trips.

They did not try to notify us by ANY means, they could have at least emailed us(MINIMUM). Also Uber would have costed $200+ all the way to Toronto. They refunded our tickets tho, but that’s still a horrible experience, because what if the other random bus never showed up? We would have literally had no way to get home. Never getting a Megabus ever again. The refund took 7 days, which is fine i gues but that service was still horrible. If i was someone travelling to Canada/newcomer and had this experience I would be very scared and worried.
